page.title: 04Housing in Stackpole
page.content: Stackpole village consists of two small council housing estates,houses erected by Lord Cawdor and one private house.The council estates were erected in the late nineteen forties and early seventies respectively.The former comprises 12 three bedroomed semi_detached houses;a half of these houses are now privately owned.The other estate consists of 23 terraced bungalows grouped in blocks of six,five and three groups of four.Some of the bungalows have two bedrooms and others have three.Retired people live in the smaller bungalows. The remainder of the houses,except one,have conections with the Cawdor estate.There are 14 of these in all.Three:the School House and the two buildings which have been used as a post office,are quite old,possibly dating back to the late 17th.century.
